item.description:
It’s Valentine’s Day! Time to treat yourself to Girl Shy, a 1924 silent movie starring Harold Lloyd. Jeff Rapsis will provide keyboard musical accompaniment. You’ll see a silent movie the way it’s supposed to be seen. For a small processing fee, you can purchase your tickets in advance at the theater’s website (I already have my ticket).

*****From the theater website:
Girl Shy (1924) starring Harold Lloyd, Jobyna Ralston. Celebrate Valentine's Day with the original romantic comedy, a Harold Lloyd gem starring one of the masters of silent comedy and featuring an unforgettable race-to-the-church finish. See Harold's best work as he intended it: on the big screen, in 35mm prints, and with live music. Also includes an earlier Lloyd comedy short, also in 35mm. Admission $15.
*****

I plan to arrive by 6:45 p.m., and I’ll wait in the theater lobby until 7:00 or so. Look for me carrying a red backpack. We can introduce ourselves before the movie begins. (The movie and musical performance start at 7:30 p.m.)

At about 7:00 or so, I will move into the theater auditorium so we can get seats. You can find me in the theater auditorium if you are late.

After the movie, I will wait in the theater lobby to gather everyone. Look for the red backpack. We can go out after the movie for tea or coffee, or a bite to eat, whatever the group decides.

>>If<< we decide to go out after the movie, be prepared to add 25% to the cost of your order for both the tax and the tip. Restaurants in the area add the gratuity to the check automatically. Bring CASH to make division of the check easier.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend this event so I know who to look for.

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the red backpack. Read the event description for more details.
